intro: Chamaepeuce echinocephala, commonly known as the spiny-headed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a bushy growth habit with dense clusters of small, spiny leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in compact inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
